remarks: Generalized triangle inequality: the absolute value of an infinite sum is less than or equal to the sum of absolute values.  (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 10-Sep-2007.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-May-2014.)
statement:
iserabs.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
iserabs.2 $e |- ( ph -> seq M ( + , F ) ~~> A ) $.
iserabs.3 $e |- ( ph -> seq M ( + , G ) ~~> B ) $.
iserabs.5 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
iserabs.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) e. CC ) $.
iserabs.7 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( G ` k ) = ( abs ` ( F ` k ) ) ) $.
iserabs $p |- ( ph -> ( abs ` A ) <_ B ) $.
$d F k $.
$d G k $.
$d M k $.
$d Z k $.
$d k ph $.
